sn30.3:4.2: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha,
sn30.3:4.3: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn30.3:4.5: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the egg-born phoenixes?”
sn30.3:4.6: “Mendicant, it’s when someone does both kinds of deeds by body, speech, and mind.
sn30.3:4.8: ‘The egg-born phoenixes are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
sn30.3:4.10: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the egg-born phoenixes!’
sn30.3:4.11: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the egg-born phoenixes.
sn30.3:4.12: This is the cause, this is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the egg-born phoenixes.”
